item.description:
Please RSVP at the facebook event page as well: http://www.facebook.com/events/402931863062877/

FIRE SPINNING! MUSIC! BEER! RAFFLES! FOOD!

Featuring Musical Performances By:
JORDAN PAGE
DAVE QUICK
STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSE
POLLEN
DJ SCOTTY BEGEY
TODD COTE
AND MORE TBA


All proceeds go to benefit Spirits of '76, a non-profit dedicated to providing volunteer service at the community level.

A limited number of pre-advance tickets will go on sale soon for $15 soon. Advance tickets $25, the week of the event and at the gate tickets $30.

Children under 12 years age are admitted for free with parent or guardian

Stay tuned for more details!

*Spirits of '76 is a 501(3)C non-profit. We do not endorse, promote our support any political parties or candidates.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

-Jordan Page-

Jordan Page is a young Singer/Songwriter and itinerant musician seeking to mobilize a new generation to stand up for their country and the rights of the individual. Jordan uses his talents to promote a message of peace while educating and mobilizing resistance to tyranny and the erosion of American civil rights.

 

 

 

 

 

-Dave Quick-

Dave Quick's entertainment and writing career has now spanned over three decades. You may have caught his act at the Hartford Civic Center, New Haven Colosseum, Yale Bowl, Light HousePoint, out on Block Island, on the National Television T.N.N. Network "Be A Star Show." or a quaint restaurant or coffee shop. Along the way you may have seen him as a special guest with the likes of David Crosby, Roger McGuinn, Dan Seals, Eddie Rabbit, James Taylor, Don McClean, Jonathan Edwards, and Arlo Guthry. Big or small venues, where ever he is he holds true to his sound with his warm vocals, harmonica, and sweet Martin acoustic guitar. From Torrington to Tampa, and all points in-between. A true troubadour who will always feel at home, out on the road.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

-Students of the Universe-

SOTU (Students of the Universe) was formed in 2011 when professionally unemployed, singer/guitarist, Jesse Lynch, and unsuccessful window salesmen/ drummer, Justin “Freebird” Freeman, began musically fornicating together after having played together in One Good Vibe, a short lived jam band that was highly regarded by smart people in northwest CT . The addition of bassist/ music theory guru/ex-Chili’s waiter, Kenny Sciuto, and guitar player/flutist/all around nice guy, Mike Wiedl, rounded out the lineup.


 

 

 

 

 

 

-Pollen-

Pollen is a gigging jamband in NW Connecticut. We play Grateful Dead, Jerry Garcia, Phish, Allman Brothers, Leftover Salmon, SCI and a variety of other covers ranging from Johnny Cash, KWS, Bob Dylan, Sublime on through to Tom Petty.
item.name: Spirit of '76's Second Annual Freedom Festival
